Constructors

constructor

  • new SiweMessage(param: string | Partial<SiweMessage>): SiweMessage
    • Defined in client.ts:86

    Creates a parsed Sign-In with Ethereum Message (EIP-4361) object from a string or an object. If a string is used an ABNF parser is called to validate the parameter, otherwise the fields are attributed.

    Parameters

    • param: string | Partial<SiweMessage>

      Sign message as a string or an object.

    Returns SiweMessage

Properties

address

address: string
  • Defined in client.ts:35

Ethereum address performing the signing conformant to capitalization encoded checksum specified in EIP-55 where applicable.

chainId

chainId: number
  • Defined in client.ts:46

EIP-155 Chain ID to which the session is bound, and the network where Contract Accounts must be resolved.

domain

domain: string
  • Defined in client.ts:32

RFC 4501 dns authority that is requesting the signing.

Optional expirationTime

expirationTime?: string
  • Defined in client.ts:54

ISO 8601 datetime string that, if present, indicates when the signed authentication message is no longer valid.

issuedAt

issuedAt: string
  • Defined in client.ts:51

ISO 8601 datetime string of the current time.

nonce

nonce: string
  • Defined in client.ts:49

Randomized token used to prevent replay attacks, at least 8 alphanumeric characters.

Optional notBefore

notBefore?: string
  • Defined in client.ts:57

ISO 8601 datetime string that, if present, indicates when the signed authentication message will become valid.

Optional requestId

requestId?: string
  • Defined in client.ts:60

System-specific identifier that may be used to uniquely refer to the sign-in request.

Optional resources

resources?: string[]
  • Defined in client.ts:64

List of information or references to information the user wishes to have resolved as part of authentication by the relying party. They are expressed as RFC 3986 URIs separated by \n- .

Optional signature

signature?: string
  • Defined in client.ts:72
deprecated

Signature of the message signed by the wallet.

This field will be removed in future releases, an additional parameter was added to the validate function were the signature goes to validate the message.

Optional statement

statement?: string
  • Defined in client.ts:38

Human-readable ASCII assertion that the user will sign, and it must not contain \n.

Optional type

type?: PERSONAL_SIGNATURE
  • Defined in client.ts:78
deprecated

Type of sign message to be generated.

This field will be removed in future releases and will rely on the message version

uri

uri: string
  • Defined in client.ts:41

RFC 3986 URI referring to the resource that is the subject of the signing (as in the subject of a claim).

version

version: string
  • Defined in client.ts:43

Current version of the message.

Methods

prepareMessage

  • prepareMessage(): string
    • Defined in client.ts:204

    This method parses all the fields in the object and creates a sign message according with the type defined.

    Returns string

    Returns a message ready to be signed according with the type defined in the object.

regexFromMessage

  • regexFromMessage(message: string): RegExpExecArray
    • Defined in client.ts:114

    Given a sign message (EIP-4361) returns the correct matching groups.

    Parameters

    • message: string

    Returns RegExpExecArray

    The matching groups for the message

signMessage

  • signMessage(): string
    • Defined in client.ts:189
    deprecated

    signMessage method is deprecated, use prepareMessage instead.

    This method parses all the fields in the object and creates a sign message according with the type defined.

    Returns string

    Returns a message ready to be signed according with the type defined in the object.

toMessage

  • toMessage(): string
    • Defined in client.ts:127

    This function can be used to retrieve an EIP-4361 formated message for signature, although you can call it directly it's advised to use [signMessage()] instead which will resolve to the correct method based on the [type] attribute of this object, in case of other formats being implemented.

    Returns string

    EIP-4361 formated message, ready for EIP-191 signing.

validate

  • validate(signature?: string, provider?: any): Promise<SiweMessage>
    • Defined in client.ts:228

    Validates the integrity of the fields of this objects by matching it's signature.

    Parameters

    • signature: string = ...
    • Optional provider: any

      A Web3 provider able to perform a contract check, this is required if support for Smart Contract Wallets that implement EIP-1271 is needed.

    Returns Promise<SiweMessage>

    This object if valid.
